bug.short_desc: addNativeListener in qx.bom.Event doesn't map "this" in the listener function to target Object on IE

long_desc.thetext: addNativeListener tries to offer a common api call to adding events on elements. it abstracts away the addEventListener and attachEvent but the function that handles the event treats "this" in a different way. "this" means the global window on IE and the target element on the other browsers. it should be the target element, passed as first argument to addNativeListener
Alex, I assign the bug to you just to get your feedback. What do you think about it? Should we "normalize" the "this" in the native listeners too? Is it more an enhancement of a bugfix?

The "addNativeListener" method directly hands over the parameters to "addEventListener / attachEvent" and the application developer is informed about it in the API docs. ("Wrapper around native event management capabilities of the browser. This class should not be used directly normally. Itâ€™s better to use qx.event.Registration instead.")
Those two browser methods do not support setting a context natively, so we should not implement this here in this method. The name of the method should be explaining the functionality. It's about adding a *native* listener directly and bypassing the qooxdoo event management and the normalization. I propose to leave the method as it is.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en/DOM/element.addEventListener http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms536343(v=VS.85).aspx
Alex's argument are right. Talked to Gabriel about it and we decided to keep it the was it is. --> WONTFIX
